intro: Pimpinella nodosa, commonly known as the nodding cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has a slender, branching stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in early spring. Pimpinella nodosa is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in rich, loamy soil.
